p: As in the present study, where the interviews were conducted with non-specialists and with native vegetation occurring close to the residences, the interview location was also studied in southeastern Madagascar. That study found that the proximity of the participants’ house to the forest had no influence on the medicinal plants mentioned [ 12]. In this rural Brazilian community, interviews were conducted in closed and in open spaces, where in the latter the participant had visual contact with nature and yet location did not interfere with list’s content of the free lists. However, studies need to be repeated in other communities to understand if these results represent a general pattern.
